00075 
00076 /*
00077  * struct Header - this structure is used 
00078  * internally by Fortify to manage it's 
00079  * own private lists of memory.
00080  */
00081 struct Header {
00082        WORD           Checksum;     /* For the integrity of our goodies  */
00083        const char    *File;         /* The sourcefile of the allocator   */
00084        DWORD          Line;         /* The sourceline of the allocator   */
00085 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00086        const char    *FreedFile;    /* The sourcefile of the deallocator */
00087        DWORD          FreedLine;    /* The sourceline of the deallocator */
00088        BYTE           Deallocator;  /* The deallocator used              */
00089 #endif
00090        size_t         Size;         /* The size of the malloc'd block    */
00091        struct Header *Prev;         /* Previous link                     */
00092        struct Header *Next;         /* Next link                         */
00093        char          *Label;        /* User's Label (may be null)        */
00094        BYTE           Scope;        /* Scope level of the caller         */
00095        BYTE           Allocator;    /* malloc/realloc/new/etc            */
00096      };
00097 
00098 /*
00099  * Round x up to the nearest multiple of n.
00100  */
00101 #define ROUND_UP(x,n)        ((((x) + (n)-1)/(n))*(n))
00102 
00103 #define FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE  ROUND_UP(sizeof(struct Header), sizeof(WORD))
00104 
00105 /*
00106  * FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE is FORTIFY_BEFORE_SIZE rounded up to the
00107  * next multiple of FORTIFY_ALIGNMENT. This is so that we can guarantee
00108  * the alignment of user memory for such systems where this is important
00109  * (eg storing doubles on a SPARC)
00110  */
00111 #define FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE ( \
00112         ROUND_UP (FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE+FORTIFY_BEFORE_SIZE, FORTIFY_ALIGNMENT) \
00113         - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE)
00114 
00115 /*
00116  * FORTIFY_OVERHEAD is the total overhead added by Fortify to each
00117  * memory block.
00118  */
00119 #define FORTIFY_OVERHEAD (FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE         + \
00120                           FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + \
00121                           FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE)
00122 
00123

00128 STATIC int  st_CheckFortification (BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size);
00129 STATIC void st_SetFortification   (BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size);
00130 STATIC void st_OutputFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size);
00131 STATIC void st_HexDump            (BYTE *ptr, size_t offset, size_t size, int title);
00132 STATIC int  st_IsHeaderValid      (struct Header *h);
00133 STATIC void st_MakeHeaderValid    (struct Header *h);
00134 STATIC WORD st_ChecksumHeader     (struct Header *h);
00135 STATIC int  st_IsOnAllocatedList  (struct Header *h);
00136 STATIC void st_OutputHeader       (struct Header *h);
00137 STATIC void st_OutputMemory       (struct Header *h);
00138 STATIC void st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint(void);
00139 STATIC void st_DefaultOutput      (const char *String);
00140 STATIC const char *st_MemoryBlockString(struct Header *h);
00141 STATIC void st_OutputDeleteTrace (void);
00142 
00143 #if defined (FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY)
00144 #if defined (FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY) && \
00145     defined (FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY)
00146     STATIC const char *st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString(struct Header *h);
00147 #endif

00149     STATIC int st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(DWORD Bytes, const char *file, DWORD line);
00150     STATIC int st_PurgeDeallocatedScope(BYTE Scope, const char *file, DWORD line);
00151     STATIC int st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line);
00152     STATIC void st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line);
00153 #endif

00158  */
00159 STATIC char                  st_Buffer[4096]     = { 0 }; /* don't use BSS */
00160 STATIC struct Header        *st_AllocatedHead    = 0;
00161 STATIC int                   st_AllocateFailRate = 0;
00162 STATIC Fortify_OutputFuncPtr st_Output           = st_DefaultOutput;
00163 STATIC const char           *st_LastVerifiedFile = "unknown";
00164 STATIC DWORD                 st_LastVerifiedLine = 0;
00165 STATIC BYTE                  st_Scope            = 0;
00166 STATIC BYTE                  st_Disabled         = 0;
00167 
00168 #if defined(__HIGHC__) && 0 // !! not yet
00169 STATIC char st_LockDataStart = 0;
00170 #endif
00171 
00172 #ifdef __cplusplus
00173   int    gbl_FortifyMagic = 0;
00174   STATIC const char *st_DeleteFile[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE];
00175   STATIC DWORD       st_DeleteLine[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE];
00176   STATIC DWORD       st_DeleteStackTop;

00180 STATIC DWORD  st_MaxBlocks        = 0;
00181 STATIC DWORD  st_MaxAllocation    = 0;
00182 STATIC DWORD  st_CurBlocks        = 0;
00183 STATIC DWORD  st_CurAllocation    = 0;
00184 STATIC DWORD  st_Allocations      = 0;
00185 STATIC DWORD  st_Frees            = 0;
00186 STATIC DWORD  st_TotalAllocation  = 0;
00187 STATIC DWORD  st_AllocationLimit  = 0xffffffff;
00188 
00189 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY

00191   STATIC struct Header *st_DeallocatedTail  = 0;
00192   STATIC DWORD          st_TotalDeallocated = 0;
00193 #endif

00198                   "malloc()",
00199                   "calloc()",
00200                   "realloc()",
00201                   "strdup()",
00202                   "new",
00203                   "new[]"
00204                 };

00208                   "nobody",
00209                   "free()",
00210                   "realloc()",
00211                   "delete",
00212                   "delete[]"
00213                 };
00214 
00215 STATIC const BYTE st_ValidDeallocator[] = {
00216     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
00217     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
00218     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
00219     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
00220 #if defined(FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW) && defined(FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE)
00221     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_delete),
00222     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete)
00223 #else
00224     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_delete) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete),
00225     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_delete) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete)
00226 #endif
00227 };
00228 
00229 STATIC char st_LockDataFill[4096] = { 0 };
00230 STATIC char st_LockDataEnd        = 0;
00231 
00232 
00233 #if defined(__HIGHC__) && 0 // !! not yet
00234 
00235 #include <pharlap.h>
00236 #include <hw386.h>
00237 
00238 /*
00239  *  Change page-attributes for local data.
00240  *  Set to present or non-present pages.
00241  */
00242 STATIC Fortify_LockLocalData (int lock)
00243 {
00244   UINT  lockSize  = (ULONG)&st_LockDataEnd - (ULONG)&st_LockDataStart;
00245   ULONG num_pages = (lockSize + 4095) / 4096;
00246   ULONG page      = ((ULONG)&st_LockDataStart + 4095) / 4096;
00247 
00248   for ( ; page < page + num_pages; page++)
00249   {
00250     ULONG pte, ptInfo;
00251     if (_dx_rd_ptinfl (page << 12, &pte, &ptInfo))
00252        break;
00253     if (lock)
00254          pte &= ~PE_PRESENT;
00255     else pte |=  PE_PRESENT;
00256     if (_dx_wr_ptinfl (page << 12, pte, ptInfo))
00257        break;
00258   }
00259 }
00260 #endif
00261 
00262 
00263 /*
00264  * Fortify_Allocate() - allocate a block of fortified memory
00265  */
00266 void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
00267 Fortify_Allocate (size_t size, BYTE allocator, const char *file, DWORD line)
00268 {
00269   struct Header *h;
00270   int    another_try;
00271   BYTE  *ptr = NULL;
00272 
00273   /*
00274    * If Fortify has been disabled, then it's easy
00275    */
00276   if (st_Disabled)
00277   {
00278 #ifdef FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC
00279     if (size == 0 &&
00280         (allocator == Fortify_Allocator_new ||
00281          allocator == Fortify_Allocator_array_new))
00282     {
00283       /*
00284        * A new of zero bytes must succeed, but a malloc of
00285        * zero bytes probably won't
00286        */
00287       return malloc(1);
00288     }
00289 #endif
00290 
00291     return malloc(size);
00292   }
00293 
00294 #ifdef FORTIFY_CHECK_ALL_MEMORY_ON_ALLOCATE
00295   Fortify_CheckAllMemory (file, line);
00296 #endif  
00297 
00298   if (st_AllocateFailRate > 0)
00299   {
00300     if (rand() % 100 < st_AllocateFailRate)
00301     {
00302 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_FALSE_FAIL
00303       sprintf (st_Buffer,
00304                "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes \"false failed\" at %s.%lu\n",
00305                st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
00306       st_Output (st_Buffer);
00307 #endif
00308       return (0);
00309     }
00310   }
00311 
00312   /* Check to see if this allocation will
00313    * push us over the artificial limit
00314    */
00315   if (st_CurAllocation + size > st_AllocationLimit)
00316   {
00317 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_FALSE_FAIL
00318     sprintf (st_Buffer,
00319              "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes \"false failed\" at %s.%lu\n",
00320              st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
00321     st_Output (st_Buffer);
00322 #endif
00323     return (0);
00324   }
00325 
00326 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ZERO_MALLOC
00327   if (size == 0 && (allocator == Fortify_Allocator_malloc ||
00328                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_calloc ||
00329                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_realloc))
00330   {
00331     sprintf(st_Buffer,
00332             "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of 0 bytes attempted at %s.%lu\n",
00333             st_AllocatorName[allocator], file, line);
00334     st_Output(st_Buffer);
00335   }
00336 #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ZERO_MALLOC */
00337 
00338 #ifdef FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC
00339   if (size == 0 && (allocator == Fortify_Allocator_malloc ||
00340                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_calloc ||
00341                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_realloc))
00342   {
00343 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL
00344     sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes failed at %s.%lu\n",
00345             st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
00346     st_Output(st_Buffer);
00347 #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL */
00348     return (0);
00349   }
00350 #endif /* FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC */    
00351 
00352 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_SIZE_T_OVERFLOW
00353     /*
00354      * Ensure the size of the memory block
00355      * plus the overhead isn't bigger than
00356      * size_t (that'd be a drag)
00357      */
00358     {
00359         size_t private_size = FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE
00360                             + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + size + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE;
00361 
00362         if (private_size < size)
00363         {
00364             sprintf(st_Buffer, 
00365                     "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes has overflowed size_t at %s.%lu\n",
00366                     st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
00367             st_Output(st_Buffer);
00368             return (0);
00369         }
00370 #if (DOSX) && defined(__WATCOMC__) && 0
00371         if (private_size >= 65536UL)
00372         {
00373             sprintf(st_Buffer, 
00374                     "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes has exceeded 64kB limit by %d bytes, at %s.%lu\n",
00375                     st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size,
00376                     private_size - size, file, line);
00377             st_Output(st_Buffer);
00378             return (0);
00379         }
00380 #endif
00381     }
00382 #endif                              
00383 
00384     another_try = 1;
00385     do
00386     {
00387         /*
00388          * malloc the memory, including the space 
00389          * for the header and fortification buffers
00390          */  
00391         ptr = (BYTE *)malloc ( FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE
00392                                    + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE
00393                                    + size
00394                                    + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
00395 
00396 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00397         /*
00398          * If we're tracking deallocated memory, then
00399          * we can free some of it, rather than let
00400          * this malloc fail
00401          */
00402         if (!ptr)
00403            another_try = st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(size, file, line);
00404 
00405 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
00406 
00407     }
00408     while (!ptr && another_try);
00409 
00410     if (!ptr)
00411     {
00412 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL
00413         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes failed at %s.%lu\n",
00414                 st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
00415         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00416 #endif
00417         return (0);
00418     }
00419 
00420     /*
00421      * Begin Critical Region
00422      */
00423     FORTIFY_LOCK();
00424 
00425 
00426     /* 
00427      * Make the head's prev pointer point to us
00428      * ('cos we're about to become the head)
00429      */
00430     if (st_AllocatedHead)
00431     {
00432         st_CheckBlock(st_AllocatedHead, file, line);
00433         /* what should we do if this fails? (apart from panic) */
00434 
00435         st_AllocatedHead->Prev = (struct Header *)ptr;
00436         st_MakeHeaderValid(st_AllocatedHead);  
00437     }
00438 
00439     /*
00440      * Initialize and validate the header
00441      */
00442     h = (struct Header *)ptr;
00443     h->Size      = size;
00444     h->File      = file;
00445     h->Line      = line;  
00446     h->Next      = st_AllocatedHead;
00447     h->Prev      = 0;
00448     h->Scope     = st_Scope;
00449     h->Allocator = allocator;
00450     h->Label     = 0;
00451 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00452     h->FreedFile = 0;
00453     h->FreedLine = 0;
00454     h->Deallocator = Fortify_Deallocator_nobody;
00455 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
00456     st_MakeHeaderValid(h);
00457     st_AllocatedHead = h;
00458   
00459     /*
00460      * Initialize the fortifications
00461      */    
00462     st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
00463                      FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
00464     st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + size,
00465                      FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
00466 
00467 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_ALLOCATE
00468     /*
00469      * Fill the actual user memory
00470      */
00471     st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
00472                         FORTIFY_FILL_ON_ALLOCATE_VALUE, size);
00473 #endif
00474 
00475     /*
00476      * End Critical Region
00477      */
00478     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00479 
00480 
00481     /*
00482      * update the statistics
00483      */
00484     st_TotalAllocation += size;
00485     st_Allocations++;
00486     st_CurBlocks++;
00487     st_CurAllocation += size;
00488     if (st_CurBlocks > st_MaxBlocks)
00489         st_MaxBlocks = st_CurBlocks;
00490     if (st_CurAllocation > st_MaxAllocation)
00491         st_MaxAllocation = st_CurAllocation;
00492 
00493     /*
00494      * We return the address of the user's memory, not the start of the block,
00495      * which points to our magic cookies
00496      */
00497     return (ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
00498 }
00499 
00500 
00501 
00502 /*
00503  * Fortify_Deallocate() - Free a block of memory allocated with Fortify_Allocate()
00504  */
00505 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
00506 Fortify_Deallocate(void *uptr, BYTE deallocator, const char *file, DWORD line)
00507 {
00508     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr
00509                         - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE
00510                         - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
00511     struct Header *h   = (struct Header *)ptr;
00512 
00513 #ifdef FORTIFY_CHECK_ALL_MEMORY_ON_DEALLOCATE
00514     Fortify_CheckAllMemory(file, line);
00515 #endif
00516 
00517     /*
00518      * If Fortify has been disabled, then it's easy
00519      * (well, almost)
00520      */
00521     if (st_Disabled)
00522     {
00523         /* there is a possibility that this memory
00524          * block was allocated when Fortify was
00525          * enabled, so we must check the Allocated
00526          * list before we free it.
00527          */
00528         if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
00529         {
00530             free(uptr);    
00531             return;
00532         }    
00533         else
00534         {
00535             /* the block was allocated by Fortify, so we 
00536              * gotta free it differently.
00537              */
00538             /*
00539              * Begin critical region
00540              */
00541             FORTIFY_LOCK();
00542         
00543             /*
00544              * Remove the block from the list
00545              */
00546             if (h->Prev)
00547                 h->Prev->Next = h->Next;
00548             else
00549                 st_AllocatedHead = h->Next;
00550         
00551             if (h->Next)
00552                 h->Next->Prev = h->Prev;
00553         
00554             /*
00555              * End Critical Region
00556              */
00557             FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00558 
00559             /*
00560              * actually free the memory
00561              */
00562             free(ptr);
00563             return;
00564         }
00565     }
00566 
00567 
00568 #ifdef FORTIFY_PARANOID_DEALLOCATE
00569     if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
00570     {
00571 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00572         if (st_IsOnDeallocatedList(h))
00573         {
00574             sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: \"%s\" twice of %s detected at %s.%lu\n",
00575                                 st_DeallocatorName[deallocator],
00576                                 st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
00577             st_Output(st_Buffer);
00578 
00579             sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
00580                                 st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
00581             st_Output(st_Buffer);
00582             st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00583             return;
00584         }
00585 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
00586 
00587         sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Possible \"%s\" twice of (%08lX) was detected at %s.%lu\n",
00588                  st_DeallocatorName[deallocator], (DWORD)uptr, file, line);
00589 
00590         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00591         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00592         return;
00593     }
00594 #endif /* FORTIFY_PARANOID_DELETE */
00595 
00596     /*
00597      * Make sure the block is okay before we free it.
00598      * If it's not okay, don't free it - it might not
00599      * be a real memory block. Or worse still, someone
00600      * might still be writing to it
00601      */
00602     if (!st_CheckBlock(h, file, line))
00603     {
00604         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00605         return;
00606     }
00607 
00608 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00609     /*
00610      * Make sure the block hasn't been freed already
00611      * (we can get to here if FORTIFY_PARANOID_DELETE
00612      * is off, but FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00613      * is on).
00614      */
00615     if (h->Deallocator != Fortify_Deallocator_nobody)
00616     {
00617         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: \"%s\" twice of %s detected at %s.%lu\n",
00618                               st_DeallocatorName[deallocator],
00619                             st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
00620         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00621 
00622         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
00623                             st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
00624         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00625         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00626         return;
00627     }
00628 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
00629 
00630     /*
00631      * Make sure the block is being freed with a valid
00632      * deallocator. If not, complain. (but free it anyway)
00633      */
00634     if ((st_ValidDeallocator[h->Allocator] & (1 << deallocator)) == 0)
00635     {
00636         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Incorrect deallocator \"%s\" detected at %s.%lu\n",
00637                               st_DeallocatorName[deallocator], file, line);
00638         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00639         sprintf(st_Buffer,   "         %s was allocated with \"%s\"\n",
00640                               st_MemoryBlockString(h), st_AllocatorName[h->Allocator]);
00641         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00642         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00643     }
00644 
00645     /*
00646      * Begin critical region
00647      */
00648     FORTIFY_LOCK();
00649 
00650     /*
00651      * Remove the block from the list
00652      */
00653     if (h->Prev)
00654     {
00655         if (!st_CheckBlock(h->Prev, file, line))
00656         {
00657             FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00658             st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00659             return;
00660         }
00661 
00662         h->Prev->Next = h->Next;
00663         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Prev);
00664     }
00665     else
00666         st_AllocatedHead = h->Next;
00667 
00668     if (h->Next)
00669     {
00670         if (!st_CheckBlock(h->Next, file, line))
00671         {
00672             FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00673             st_OutputDeleteTrace();
00674             return;
00675         }
00676 
00677         h->Next->Prev = h->Prev;
00678         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Next);
00679     }
00680 
00681     /*
00682      * End Critical Region
00683      */
00684     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00685 
00686     /*
00687      * update the statistics
00688      */
00689     st_Frees++;
00690     st_CurBlocks--;
00691     st_CurAllocation -= h->Size;
00692 
00693 
00694 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00695     if (st_Scope > 0)
00696     {
00697         /*
00698          * Don't _actually_ free the memory block, just yet.
00699          * Place it onto the deallocated list, instead, so
00700          * we can check later to see if it's been written to.
00701          */
00702     #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE
00703         /*
00704          * Nuke out all user memory that is about to be freed
00705          */
00706         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
00707                                     FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE,
00708                                   h->Size);
00709     #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE */
00710 
00711         /*
00712          * Begin critical region
00713          */
00714         FORTIFY_LOCK();
00715 
00716         /*
00717          * Place the block on the deallocated list
00718          */
00719         if (st_DeallocatedHead)
00720         {
00721             st_DeallocatedHead->Prev = (struct Header *)ptr;
00722             st_MakeHeaderValid(st_DeallocatedHead);
00723         }
00724 
00725         h = (struct Header *)ptr;
00726         h->FreedFile   = file;
00727         h->FreedLine   = line;
00728         h->Deallocator = deallocator;
00729         h->Next        = st_DeallocatedHead;
00730         h->Prev        = 0;
00731         st_MakeHeaderValid(h);
00732         st_DeallocatedHead = h;
00733 
00734         if (!st_DeallocatedTail)
00735         {
00736             st_DeallocatedTail = h;
00737         }
00738 
00739         st_TotalDeallocated += h->Size;
00740 
00741     #ifdef FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT
00742         /*
00743          * If we've got too much on the deallocated list; free some
00744          */
00745         if (st_TotalDeallocated > FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT)
00746         {
00747              st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(st_TotalDeallocated - FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT, file, line);
00748         }
00749     #endif
00750 
00751         /*
00752          * End critical region
00753          */
00754         FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00755     }
00756     else
00757 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
00758     {
00759            /*
00760          * Free the User Label
00761          */
00762         if (h->Label)
00763         {
00764             free(h->Label);
00765         }             
00766 
00767 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE
00768         /*
00769          * Nuke out all memory that is about to be freed, including the header
00770          */
00771         st_SetFortification(ptr, FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE,
00772                               FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
00773 #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE */
00774 
00775         /*
00776          * And do the actual free
00777          */
00778         free(ptr);
00779     }
00780 }
00781 
00782 
00783 /*
00784  * Fortify_LabelPointer() - Labels the memory block
00785  * with a string provided by the user. This function
00786  * takes a copy of the passed in string.
00787  * The pointer MUST be one returned by a Fortify
00788  * allocation function.
00789  */
00790 void
00791 Fortify_LabelPointer(void *uptr, const char *label, const char *file, DWORD line)
00792 {
00793     if (!st_Disabled)
00794     {
00795         BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr
00796                               - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
00797         struct Header *h = (struct Header *)ptr;
00798 
00799         /* make sure the pointer is okay */
00800         Fortify_CheckPointer(uptr, file, line);
00801     
00802         /* free the previous label */
00803         if (h->Label)
00804         {
00805             free(h->Label);
00806         }    
00807     
00808         /* make sure the label is sensible */
00809         assert(label);
00810 
00811         /* copy it in */
00812         h->Label = (char*)malloc(strlen(label)+1);
00813         strcpy(h->Label, label);
00814         
00815         /* update the checksum */
00816         st_MakeHeaderValid(h);
00817     }
00818 }
00819 
00820 /*
00821  * Fortify_CheckPointer() - Returns true if the uptr
00822  * points to a valid piece of Fortify_Allocated()'d
00823  * memory. The memory must be on the allocated list,
00824  * and it's fortifications must be intact.
00825  * Always returns TRUE if Fortify is disabled.
00826  */
00827 int FORTIFY_STORAGE
00828 Fortify_CheckPointer(void *uptr, const char *file, DWORD line)
00829 {
00830     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr
00831                               - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
00832     struct Header *h = (struct Header *)ptr;
00833     int r;
00834 
00835     if (st_Disabled)
00836         return 1;
00837 
00838     FORTIFY_LOCK();
00839 
00840     if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
00841     {
00842         sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Invalid pointer (%08lX) detected at %s.%lu\n",
00843                  (DWORD) uptr, file, line);
00844 
00845         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00846         FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00847         return (0);
00848     }
00849 
00850 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00851     if (st_IsOnDeallocatedList(h))
00852     {
00853         sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Deallocated pointer (%08lX) detected at %s.%lu\n",
00854                  (DWORD) uptr, file, line);
00855 
00856         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00857         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
00858                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
00859         st_Output(st_Buffer);
00860         FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00861         return (0);
00862     }
00863 #endif
00864 
00865     r = st_CheckBlock(h, file, line);
00866     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00867     return r;
00868 }
00869 
00870 /*
00871  * Fortify_SetOutputFunc(Fortify_OutputFuncPtr Output) -
00872  * Sets the function used to output all error and
00873  * diagnostic messages. The output function  takes 
00874  * a single const BYTE * argument, and must be
00875  * able to handle newlines. This function returns the 
00876  * old output function.
00877  */
00878 Fortify_OutputFuncPtr FORTIFY_STORAGE
00879 Fortify_SetOutputFunc(Fortify_OutputFuncPtr Output)
00880 {
00881     Fortify_OutputFuncPtr Old = st_Output;
00882 
00883     st_Output = Output;
00884   
00885     return (Old);
00886 }
00887 
00888 /*
00889  * Fortify_SetAllocateFailRate(int Percent) - 
00890  * Fortify_Allocate() will "fail" this Percent of 
00891  * the time, even if the memory is available. 
00892  * Useful to "stress-test" an application. 
00893  * Returns the old value.
00894  * The fail rate defaults to 0 (a good default I think).
00895  */
00896 int FORTIFY_STORAGE
00897 Fortify_SetAllocateFailRate(int Percent)
00898 {
00899     int Old = st_AllocateFailRate;
00900   
00901     st_AllocateFailRate = Percent;
00902   
00903     return (Old);
00904 }
00905 
00906  
00907 /*
00908  * Fortify_CheckAllMemory() - Checks the fortifications
00909  * of all memory on the allocated list. And, if 
00910  * FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY is enabled, all the
00911  * known deallocated memory as well.
00912  * Returns the number of blocks that failed. 
00913  * Always returns 0 if Fortify is disabled.
00914  */
00915 DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
00916 Fortify_CheckAllMemory(const char *file, DWORD line)
00917 {
00918     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
00919     DWORD count = 0;
00920 
00921     if (st_Disabled)
00922         return 0;
00923 
00924     FORTIFY_LOCK();
00925 
00926     /*
00927      * Check the allocated memory
00928      */ 
00929     while (curr)
00930     {
00931         if (!st_CheckBlock(curr, file, line))
00932         {
00933           count++;
00934           break;    // !! added, GV 13/7-98
00935         }
00936         curr = curr->Next;      
00937     }
00938 
00939     /*
00940      * Check the deallocated memory while you're at it
00941      */
00942 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
00943     curr = st_DeallocatedHead;
00944     while (curr)
00945     {
00946         if (!st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(curr, file, line))
00947             count++;
00948 
00949         curr = curr->Next;      
00950     }
00951 #endif    
00952 
00953     /*  
00954      * If we know where we are, and everything is cool,
00955      * remember that. It might be important.
00956      */
00957     if (file && count == 0)
00958     {
00959         st_LastVerifiedFile = file;
00960         st_LastVerifiedLine = line;
00961     }
00962 
00963     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
00964     return (count);
00965 }
00966 
00967 
00968 /*
00969  * Fortify_EnterScope() - enters a new Fortify scope 
00970  * level. Returns the new scope level.
00971  */
00972 BYTE FORTIFY_STORAGE
00973 Fortify_EnterScope(const char *file, DWORD line)
00974 {
00975 //    ARGSUSED (file);
00976 //    ARGSUSED (line);
00977     return (++st_Scope);
00978 }
00979 
00980 /* Fortify_LeaveScope - leaves a Fortify scope level,
00981  * also prints a memory dump of all non-freed memory 
00982  * that was allocated during the scope being exited.
00983  * Does nothing and returns 0 if Fortify is disabled.
00984  */
00985 BYTE FORTIFY_STORAGE
00986 Fortify_LeaveScope(const char *file, DWORD line)
00987 {
00988     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
00989     DWORD size = 0, count = 0;
00990 
00991     if (st_Disabled)
00992         return 0;
00993 
00994     FORTIFY_LOCK();
00995 
00996     st_Scope--;
00997     while (curr)
00998     {
00999         if (curr->Scope > st_Scope)
01000         {
01001             if (count == 0)
01002             {
01003                 sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Memory leak detected leaving scope at %s.%lu\n", file, line);
01004                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
01005                 sprintf(st_Buffer, "%10s %8s %s\n", "Address", "Size", "Allocator");
01006                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
01007             }
01008             
01009             st_OutputHeader(curr);
01010             count++;
01011             size += curr->Size;
01012         }
01013 
01014         curr = curr->Next;      
01015     }
01016 
01017     if (count)
01018     {
01019         sprintf(st_Buffer,"%8s %8lu bytes in %lu blocks with %lu bytes overhead\n",
01020                 "total", size, count, count * FORTIFY_OVERHEAD);
01021         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01022     }
01023 
01024 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01025     /* 
01026      * Quietly free all the deallocated memory 
01027      * that was allocated in this scope that 
01028      * we are still tracking
01029      */
01030     st_PurgeDeallocatedScope (st_Scope, file, line);
01031 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01032 
01033     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
01034     return (st_Scope);
01035 }
01036 
01037 /*
01038  * Fortify_ListAllMemory() - Outputs the entire 
01039  * list of currently allocated memory. For each block 
01040  * is output it's Address, Size, and the SourceFile and 
01041  * Line that allocated it.
01042  *
01043  * If there is no memory on the list, this function 
01044  * outputs nothing.
01045  *
01046  * It returns the number of blocks on the list, unless 
01047  * Fortify has been disabled, in which case it always 
01048  * returns 0.
01049  */
01050 DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
01051 Fortify_ListAllMemory(const char *file, DWORD line)
01052 {
01053     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
01054     DWORD size = 0, count = 0;
01055 
01056     if (st_Disabled)
01057         return 0;
01058 
01059     Fortify_CheckAllMemory(file, line);
01060 
01061     FORTIFY_LOCK();
01062 
01063     if (curr)
01064     {
01065         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\n\nFortify: Memory List at %s.%lu\n", file, line);
01066         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01067         sprintf(st_Buffer, "%10s %8s %s\n", "Address", "Size", "Allocator");
01068         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01069                                 
01070         while (curr)
01071         {
01072             st_OutputHeader(curr);
01073             count++;
01074             size += curr->Size;
01075             curr = curr->Next;      
01076         }
01077                      
01078         sprintf(st_Buffer, "%8s %8lu bytes in %lu blocks and %lu bytes overhead\n",
01079                            "total", size, count, count * FORTIFY_OVERHEAD);
01080         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01081     }
01082   
01083     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
01084     return (count);
01085 }
01086 
01087 /*
01088  * Fortify_DumpAllMemory() - Outputs the entire list of 
01089  * currently allocated memory. For each allocated block 
01090  * is output it's Address, Size, the SourceFile and Line
01091  * that allocated it, a hex dump of the contents of the 
01092  * memory and an ascii dump of printable characters.
01093  *
01094  * If there is no memory on the list, this function outputs nothing.
01095  */
01096 DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
01097 Fortify_DumpAllMemory(const char *file, DWORD line)
01098 {
01099     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
01100     DWORD count = 0;
01101 
01102     if (st_Disabled)
01103         return 0;
01104 
01105     Fortify_CheckAllMemory(file, line);
01106 
01107     FORTIFY_LOCK();
01108 
01109     while (curr)
01110     {
01111         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Hex Dump of %s at %s.%lu\n",
01112                 st_MemoryBlockString(curr), file, line);
01113         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01114         st_OutputMemory(curr);
01115         st_Output("\n");
01116         count++;
01117 
01118         curr = curr->Next;
01119     }
01120 
01121     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
01122     return (count);
01123 }
01124 
01125 /* Fortify_OutputStatistics() - displays statistics 
01126  * about the maximum amount of memory that was 
01127  * allocated at any one time.
01128  */
01129 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
01130 Fortify_OutputStatistics(const char *file, DWORD line)
01131 {
01132     if (st_Disabled)
01133         return;
01134 
01135     sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Statistics at %s.%lu\n", file, line);
01136     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01137 
01138     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory currently allocated: %lu bytes in %lu blocks\n",
01139                                  st_CurAllocation, st_CurBlocks);
01140     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01141     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Maximum memory allocated at one time: %lu bytes in %lu blocks\n", 
01142                                  st_MaxAllocation, st_MaxBlocks);
01143     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01144     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         There have been %lu allocations and %lu deallocations\n",
01145                                  st_Allocations, st_Frees);
01146     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01147     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         There was a total of %lu bytes allocated\n",
01148                                  st_TotalAllocation);
01149     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01150     
01151     if (st_Allocations > 0)
01152     {
01153         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         The average allocation was %lu bytes\n",
01154                                      st_TotalAllocation / st_Allocations);
01155         st_Output(st_Buffer);                   
01156     }    
01157 }
01158 
01159 /* Fortify_GetCurrentAllocation() - returns the number of
01160  * bytes currently allocated.
01161  */
01162 DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
01163 Fortify_GetCurrentAllocation(const char *file, DWORD line)
01164 {
01165 //    ARGSUSED (file);
01166 //    ARGSUSED (line);
01167 
01168     if (st_Disabled)
01169         return 0;
01170 
01171     return st_CurAllocation;
01172 }
01173 
01174 /* Fortify_SetAllocationLimit() - set a limit on the total
01175  * amount of memory allowed for this application.
01176  */
01177 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
01178 Fortify_SetAllocationLimit(DWORD NewLimit, const char *file, DWORD line)
01179 {
01180 //    ARGSUSED (file);
01181 //    ARGSUSED (line);
01182 
01183     st_AllocationLimit = NewLimit;
01184 }
01185 
01186 /*
01187  * Fortify_Disable() - Run time method of disabling Fortify.
01188  * Useful if you need to turn off Fortify without recompiling
01189  * everything. Not as effective as compiling out, of course.
01190  * The less memory allocated by Fortify when it is disabled
01191  * the better.
01192  * (Previous versions of Fortify did not allow it to be 
01193  * disabled if there was any memory allocated at the time,
01194  * but since in C++ memory is often allocated before main
01195  * is even entered, this was useless so Fortify is now
01196  * able to cope).
01197  */
01198 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
01199 Fortify_Disable(const char *file, DWORD line)
01200 {
01201 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01202     /* free all deallocated memory we might be tracking */
01203     st_PurgeDeallocatedScope (0, file, line);
01204 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01205 
01206     st_Disabled = 1;
01207 }
01208 
01209 
01210 
01211 /*
01212  * st_CheckBlock - Check a block's header and fortifications.
01213  * Returns true if the block is happy.
01214  */
01215 STATIC int
01216 st_CheckBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line)
01217 {
01218     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)h;
01219     int result = 1;
01220 
01221     if (!st_IsHeaderValid(h))
01222     {
01223       sprintf (st_Buffer,
01224                "\nFortify: Invalid pointer (%08lX) or corrupted header detected at %s.%lu\n",
01225                (DWORD)(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE), file, line);
01226                 
01227       st_Output (st_Buffer);
01228       st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01229       return (0);
01230     }
01231 
01232     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
01233                            FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE))
01234     {
01235         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Underwrite detected before block %s at %s.%lu\n",
01236                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
01237         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01238 
01239         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01240         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
01241                             FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
01242         result = 0;                        
01243 
01244 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
01245         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE, FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
01246 #endif
01247     }
01248                            
01249     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
01250                            FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE))
01251     {
01252         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Overwrite detected after block %s at %s.%lu\n",
01253                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
01254         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01255 
01256         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01257         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
01258                             FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
01259         result = 0;
01260 
01261 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
01262         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
01263                          FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
01264 #endif
01265     }
01266  
01267     return (result);
01268 }
01269 
01270 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01271 
01272 /* 
01273  * st_CheckDeallocatedBlock - Check a deallocated block's header and fortifications.
01274  * Returns true if the block is happy.
01275  */
01276 STATIC int
01277 st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line)
01278 {
01279     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)h;
01280     int result = 1;
01281 
01282     if (!st_IsHeaderValid(h))
01283     {
01284       sprintf (st_Buffer,
01285                "\nFortify: Invalid deallocated pointer (%08lX) or corrupted header detected at %s.%lu\n",
01286                (DWORD)(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE), file, line);
01287                 
01288       st_Output(st_Buffer);
01289       st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01290       return (0);
01291     }
01292 
01293     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
01294             FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE))
01295     {
01296         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Underwrite detected before deallocated block %s at %s.%lu\n",
01297                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
01298         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01299         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
01300                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
01301         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01302 
01303         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01304         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
01305                             FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
01306 
01307 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
01308         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE, FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
01309 #endif
01310         result = 0;
01311     }
01312                            
01313     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
01314                            FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE))
01315     {
01316         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Overwrite detected after deallocated block %s at %s.%lu\n",
01317                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
01318         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01319         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
01320                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
01321         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01322 
01323         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01324         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
01325                             FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
01326 
01327 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
01328         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
01329                          FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
01330 #endif
01331         result = 0;
01332     }
01333 
01334 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE
01335     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01336                            FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE, h->Size))
01337     {
01338         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Write to deallocated block %s detected at %s.%lu\n",
01339                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
01340         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01341 
01342         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
01343                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
01344         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01345         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
01346     
01347         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01348                             FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE, h->Size);
01349 
01350 #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
01351         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01352                             FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE, h->Size);
01353 #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION */
01354         result = 0;
01355     }
01356 #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE */
01357     return result;
01358  }
01359 
01360 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01361 
01362 
01363 /*
01364  * st_CheckFortification - Checks if the _size_ 
01365  * bytes from _ptr_ are all set to _value_
01366  * Returns true if all is happy.
01367  */
01368 STATIC int
01369 st_CheckFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size)
01370 {
01371     while (size--)
01372         if (*ptr++ != value)
01373             return (0);
01374       
01375     return (1);
01376 }
01377 
01378 /*
01379  * st_SetFortification - Set the _size_ bytes from _ptr_ to _value_.
01380  */
01381 STATIC void
01382 st_SetFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size)
01383 {
01384     memset(ptr, value, size);
01385 }
01386 
01387 /*
01388  * st_OutputFortification - Output the corrupted section of the fortification 
01389  */
01390 STATIC void
01391 st_OutputFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size)
01392 {
01393     size_t offset, skipped, advance;
01394     offset = 0;
01395 
01396     sprintf(st_Buffer, "   Address   Offset Data (%02x)", value);
01397     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01398 
01399     while (offset < size)
01400     {
01401         /* 
01402          * Skip 3 or more 'correct' lines
01403          */
01404         if ((size - offset) < 3 * 16)
01405             advance = size - offset;
01406         else
01407             advance = 3 * 16;
01408         if (advance > 0 && st_CheckFortification(ptr+offset, value, advance))
01409         {
01410             offset += advance;
01411             skipped = advance;
01412                  
01413             if (size - offset < 16)
01414                 advance = size - offset;
01415             else
01416                 advance = 16;
01417              
01418             while (advance > 0 && st_CheckFortification(ptr+offset, value, advance))
01419             {
01420                 offset  += advance;
01421                 skipped += advance;
01422                 if (size - offset < 16)
01423                     advance = size - offset;
01424                 else
01425                     advance = 16;
01426             }    
01427             sprintf(st_Buffer, "\n                        ...%lu bytes skipped...", (DWORD)skipped);
01428             st_Output(st_Buffer);
01429             continue;
01430         }
01431         else
01432         {
01433             if (size - offset < 16)
01434                 st_HexDump(ptr, offset, size-offset, 0);
01435             else
01436                 st_HexDump(ptr, offset, 16, 0);
01437                 
01438             offset += 16;
01439         }
01440     }
01441 
01442     st_Output("\n");
01443 }
01444 
01445 /*
01446  * st_HexDump - output a nice hex dump of "size" bytes, starting at "ptr" + "offset"
01447  */
01448 STATIC void
01449 st_HexDump(BYTE *ptr, size_t offset, size_t size, int title)
01450 {
01451     char ascii[17];
01452     int  column;
01453     int  output;
01454 
01455     if (title)
01456         st_Output("   Address   Offset Data");
01457 
01458     column = 0;
01459     ptr += offset;
01460     output = 0;
01461 
01462     while (output < size)
01463     {
01464         if (column == 0)
01465         {
01466           sprintf(st_Buffer, "\n%08lX %8lu ", (DWORD)ptr, (DWORD)offset);
01467           st_Output(st_Buffer);
01468         }
01469 
01470         sprintf (st_Buffer, "%02x%s", *ptr, ((column % 4) == 3) ? " " : "");
01471         st_Output (st_Buffer);
01472 
01473         ascii [column]   = isprint(*ptr) ? (char)*ptr : '.';
01474         ascii [column+1] = '\0';
01475 
01476         ptr++;
01477         offset++;
01478         output++;
01479         column++;
01480 
01481         if (column == 16)
01482         {
01483             st_Output ("   \"");
01484             st_Output (ascii);
01485             st_Output ("\"");
01486             column = 0;
01487         }
01488     }
01489 
01490     if  (column != 0)
01491     {
01492         while  (column < 16)
01493         {
01494             if  (column % 4 == 3)
01495                 st_Output ("   ");
01496             else
01497                 st_Output ("  ");
01498 
01499             column++;
01500         }
01501         st_Output ("   \"");
01502         st_Output (ascii);
01503         st_Output ("\"");
01504     }
01505 }
01506 
01507 /*
01508  * st_IsHeaderValid - Returns true if the 
01509  * supplied pointer does indeed point to a 
01510  * real Header
01511  */
01512 STATIC int
01513 st_IsHeaderValid(struct Header *h)                                
01514 {
01515     return (st_ChecksumHeader(h) == FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE);
01516 }
01517 
01518 /*
01519  * st_MakeHeaderValid - Updates the checksum 
01520  * to make the header valid
01521  */
01522 STATIC void
01523 st_MakeHeaderValid(struct Header *h)
01524 {
01525     h->Checksum = 0;
01526     h->Checksum = (WORD)(FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE - st_ChecksumHeader(h));
01527 }
01528 
01529 /*
01530  * st_ChecksumHeader - Calculate (and return) 
01531  * the checksum of the header. (Including the 
01532  * Checksum field itself. If all is well, the 
01533  * checksum returned by this function should
01534  * be FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE
01535  */
01536 STATIC WORD
01537 st_ChecksumHeader(struct Header *h)
01538 {
01539 #if defined(USE_FAST_CKSUM)
01540     return inchksum_fast (h, FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE/sizeof(WORD));
01541 #else
01542     WORD c, checksum, *p;
01543   
01544     for(c = 0, checksum = 0, p = (WORD *)h;
01545         c < FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE/sizeof(WORD); c++)
01546     {    
01547         checksum += *p++;  
01548     }    
01549     
01550     return (checksum);
01551 #endif
01552 }                  
01553 
01554 /* 
01555  * st_IsOnAllocatedList - Examines the allocated 
01556  * list to see if the given header is on it.
01557  */  
01558 STATIC int
01559 st_IsOnAllocatedList(struct Header *h)
01560 {
01561     struct Header *curr;
01562   
01563     curr = st_AllocatedHead;
01564     while (curr)
01565     {
01566         if (curr == h)
01567             return (1);
01568       
01569         curr = curr->Next;
01570     }
01571   
01572     return (0);
01573 }
01574 
01575 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01576 /* 
01577  * st_IsOnDeallocatedList - Examines the deallocated 
01578  * list to see if the given header is on it.
01579  */  
01580 STATIC int
01581 st_IsOnDeallocatedList(struct Header *h)
01582 {
01583     struct Header *curr;
01584   
01585     curr = st_DeallocatedHead;
01586     while (curr)
01587     {
01588         if (curr == h)
01589             return (1);
01590       
01591         curr = curr->Next;
01592     }
01593   
01594     return (0);
01595 }
01596 
01597 /*
01598  * st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks - free at least "Bytes"
01599  * worth of deallocated memory, starting at the 
01600  * oldest deallocated block.
01601  * Returns true if any blocks were freed.
01602  */
01603 STATIC int
01604 st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(DWORD Bytes, const char *file, DWORD line)
01605 {
01606     DWORD FreedBytes = 0;
01607     DWORD FreedBlocks = 0;
01608 
01609 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01610     sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Warning - Discarding deallocated memory at %s.%lu\n", 
01611                        file, line);
01612     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01613 #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01614 
01615     while (st_DeallocatedTail && FreedBytes < Bytes)
01616     {
01617         st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(st_DeallocatedTail, file, line);
01618         FreedBytes += st_DeallocatedTail->Size;
01619         FreedBlocks++;
01620 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01621 #ifdef FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01622         sprintf(st_Buffer, "                %s\n",
01623                            st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString(st_DeallocatedTail));
01624         st_Output(st_Buffer);
01625 #endif /* FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01626 #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01627         st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(st_DeallocatedTail, file, line);
01628     }
01629 
01630     return FreedBlocks != 0;
01631 }
01632 
01633 /*
01634  * st_PurgeDeallocatedScope - free all deallocated
01635  * memory blocks that were allocated within "Scope"
01636  */
01637 STATIC int
01638 st_PurgeDeallocatedScope(BYTE Scope, const char *file, DWORD line)
01639 {
01640     struct Header *curr;
01641     DWORD FreedBlocks = 0;
01642 
01643     curr = st_DeallocatedHead;
01644     while (curr)
01645     {
01646         struct Header *next = curr->Next;
01647         if (curr->Scope >= Scope)
01648         {
01649             st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(curr, file, line);
01650             FreedBlocks++;
01651         }
01652 
01653         curr = next;
01654     }
01655     
01656     return FreedBlocks != 0;
01657 }
01658 
01659 /*
01660  * st_FreeDeallocatedBlock - actually remove
01661  * a deallocated block from the deallocated 
01662  * list, and actually free it's memory.
01663  */
01664 STATIC void
01665 st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line)
01666 {
01667     st_CheckDeallocatedBlock (h, file, line);
01668 
01669    /* 
01670     * Begin Critical region 
01671     */
01672     FORTIFY_LOCK();
01673 
01674     st_TotalDeallocated -= h->Size;
01675     
01676     if (st_DeallocatedHead == h)
01677     {
01678         st_DeallocatedHead = h->Next;
01679     }
01680     
01681     if (st_DeallocatedTail == h)
01682     {
01683         st_DeallocatedTail = h->Prev;
01684     }
01685     
01686     if (h->Prev)
01687     {
01688         st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(h->Prev, file, line);
01689         h->Prev->Next = h->Next;
01690         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Prev);    
01691     }
01692     
01693     if (h->Next)
01694     {
01695         st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(h->Next, file, line);
01696         h->Next->Prev = h->Prev;
01697         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Next);    
01698     }
01699 
01700     /*
01701      * Free the label
01702      */
01703     if (h->Label)
01704     {
01705         free(h->Label);
01706     }
01707 
01708     /*
01709      * Nuke out all memory that is about to be freed, including the header
01710      */
01711     st_SetFortification((BYTE*)h, FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE,
01712                         FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
01713 
01714     /*
01715      * And do the actual free
01716      */
01717     free(h);
01718     
01719     /*
01720      * End critical region
01721      */
01722     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();    
01723 }
01724 
01725 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01726 
01727 /*
01728  * st_OutputMemory - Hex and ascii dump the 
01729  * user memory of a block.
01730  */
01731 STATIC void
01732 st_OutputMemory(struct Header *h)
01733 {
01734     st_HexDump((BYTE*)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01735                0, h->Size, 1);
01736 }
01737 
01738 
01739 /*
01740  * st_OutputHeader - Output the header
01741  */
01742 STATIC void st_OutputHeader (struct Header *h)
01743 {
01744   BYTE *adr = (BYTE*)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
01745 
01746   if (h->Label == NULL)
01747        sprintf (st_Buffer, "%08lX %8lu %s.%lu\n",
01748                 (DWORD) adr, (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line);
01749 
01750   else sprintf (st_Buffer, "%08lX %8lu %s.%lu %s\n",
01751                 (DWORD) adr, (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->Label);
01752   st_Output(st_Buffer);
01753 }
01754 
01755 /*
01756  * st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint - output the last
01757  * known point where everything was hoopy.
01758  */
01759 STATIC void
01760 st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint()
01761 {
01762     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory integrity was last verified at %s.%lu\n", 
01763                        st_LastVerifiedFile,
01764                        st_LastVerifiedLine);
01765     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01766 }
01767 
01768 /*
01769  * st_MemoryBlockString - constructs a string that 
01770  * desribes a memory block. (pointer,size,allocator,label)
01771  */
01772 STATIC const char *
01773 st_MemoryBlockString(struct Header *h)
01774 {
01775     static char st_BlockString[512];
01776     
01777     if (h->Label == 0)
01778     {
01779         sprintf (st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu)",
01780                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01781                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line);
01782     }            
01783     else
01784     {
01785         sprintf(st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu,%s)",
01786                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01787                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->Label);
01788     }
01789 
01790     return st_BlockString;
01791 }
01792 
01793 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01794 #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01795 #ifdef FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01796 /*
01797  * st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString - constructs
01798  * a string that desribes a deallocated memory
01799  * block. (pointer,size,allocator,deallocator)
01800  */
01801 
01802 STATIC const char *
01803 st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString(struct Header *h)
01804 {
01805     static char st_BlockString[256];
01806 
01807     if (h->Label == 0)
01808     {
01809         sprintf(st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu,%s.%lu)",
01810                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01811                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
01812     }            
01813     else
01814     {
01815         sprintf(st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu,%s.%lu,%s)",
01816                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
01817                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine, h->Label);
01818     }
01819 
01820     return st_BlockString;
01821 }
01822 #endif /* FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01823 #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01824 #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
01825 
01826 
01827 /*
01828  * st_DefaultOutput - the default output function
01829  */
01830 STATIC void
01831 st_DefaultOutput(const char *String)
01832 {
01833     fprintf(stdout, String);
01834     fflush(stdout);
01835 }
01836 
01837 /*
01838  * Fortify_malloc - Fortify's replacement malloc()
01839  */
01840 void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
01841 Fortify_malloc(size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
01842 {
01843     return Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_malloc, file, line);
01844 }
01845 
01846 /*
01847  * Fortify_realloc - Fortify's replacement realloc()
01848  */
01849 void *
01850 Fortify_realloc(void *uptr, size_t new_size, const char *file, DWORD line)
01851 {
01852     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
01853     struct Header *h = (struct Header *)ptr;
01854     void *new_ptr;
01855 
01856     /*
01857      * If Fortify is disabled, we gotta do this a little 
01858      * differently.
01859      */
01860     if (!st_Disabled)
01861     {
01862         if (!uptr)
01863             return (Fortify_Allocate(new_size, Fortify_Allocator_realloc, file, line));
01864         
01865         if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
01866         {
01867 #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
01868             if (st_IsOnDeallocatedList(h))
01869             {
01870                 sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Deallocated memory block passed to \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
01871                                     st_AllocatorName[Fortify_Allocator_realloc], file, line);
01872                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
01873                 sprintf(st_Buffer,   "         Memory block %s was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
01874                                    st_MemoryBlockString(h),
01875                                    st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
01876                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
01877                 return 0;
01878             }
01879 #endif
01880 
01881 
01882             sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Invalid pointer (%08lX) passed to realloc at %s.%lu\n",
01883                      (DWORD)ptr, file, line);
01884 
01885             st_Output(st_Buffer);
01886             return 0;
01887         }
01888 
01889         if (!st_CheckBlock(h, file, line))
01890             return 0;
01891       
01892         new_ptr = Fortify_Allocate(new_size, Fortify_Allocator_realloc, file, line);
01893         if (!new_ptr)
01894         {
01895             return (0);
01896         }
01897       
01898         if (h->Size < new_size)
01899             memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, h->Size);
01900         else
01901             memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, new_size);
01902     
01903         Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_realloc, file, line);
01904         return (new_ptr);
01905     }
01906     else
01907     {
01908         /*
01909          * If the old block was fortified, we can't use normal realloc.
01910          */
01911         if (st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
01912         {
01913             new_ptr = Fortify_Allocate(new_size, Fortify_Allocator_realloc, file, line);
01914             if (!new_ptr)
01915                 return (0);
01916           
01917             if (h->Size < new_size)
01918                 memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, h->Size);
01919             else
01920                 memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, new_size);
01921         
01922             Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_realloc, file, line);
01923             return (new_ptr);
01924         }
01925         else /* easy */
01926         {
01927             return realloc(uptr, new_size);
01928         }
01929     }
01930 }
01931 
01932 /*
01933  * Fortify_calloc - Fortify's replacement calloc
01934  */
01935 void *
01936 Fortify_calloc(size_t num, size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
01937 {
01938     if (!st_Disabled)
01939     {
01940         void *ptr = Fortify_Allocate(size * num, Fortify_Allocator_calloc, file, line);
01941         if (ptr)
01942         {
01943             memset(ptr, 0, size*num);
01944         }
01945         return ptr;
01946     }    
01947     else
01948     {
01949         return calloc(num, size);
01950     }
01951 }
01952 
01953 /*
01954  * Fortify_free - Fortify's replacement free
01955  */
01956 void  
01957 Fortify_free(void *uptr, const char *file, DWORD line)
01958 {
01959     /* it is defined to be safe to free(0) */
01960     if (uptr == 0)
01961         return;
01962 
01963     Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_free, file, line);
01964 }
01965 
01966 /*
01967  * Fortify_strdup - Fortify's replacement strdup. Since strdup isn't
01968  * ANSI, it is only provided if FORTIFY_STRDUP is defined.
01969  */
01970 #ifdef FORTIFY_STRDUP
01971 char *FORTIFY_STORAGE
01972 Fortify_strdup(const char *oldStr, const char *file, DWORD line)
01973 {
01974     if (!st_Disabled)
01975     {
01976         char *newStr = Fortify_Allocate(strlen(oldStr)+1, Fortify_Allocator_strdup, file, line);
01977         if (newStr)
01978         {
01979             strcpy(newStr, oldStr);
01980         }
01981     
01982         return newStr;
01983     }    
01984     else
01985     {
01986         return strdup(oldStr);
01987     }
01988 }
01989 #endif /* FORTIFY_STRDUP */
01990 
01991 STATIC void st_OutputDeleteTrace (void)
01992 {
01993 #ifdef __cplusplus
01994   if (st_DeleteStackTop > 1)
01995   {
01996     sprintf(st_Buffer, "Delete Trace: %s.%lu\n", st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop-1],
01997                                                  st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop-1]);
01998     st_Output(st_Buffer);
01999     for(int c = st_DeleteStackTop-2; c >= 0; c--)
02000     {
02001         sprintf(st_Buffer, "              %s.%lu\n", st_DeleteFile[c],
02002                                                      st_DeleteLine[c]);
02003         st_Output(st_Buffer);
02004     }
02005   }
02006 #endif
02007 }
02008 
02009 #ifdef __cplusplus
02010 
02011 /*
02012  * st_NewHandler() - there is no easy way to get
02013  * the new handler function. And isn't it great
02014  * how the new handler doesn't take a parameter
02015  * giving the size of the request that failed.
02016  * Thanks Bjarne!
02017  */
02018 Fortify_NewHandlerFunc
02019 st_NewHandler()
02020 {
02021     /* get the current handler */
02022     Fortify_NewHandlerFunc handler = set_new_handler(0);
02023 
02024     /* and set it back (since we cant 
02025      * get it without changing it)
02026      */
02027     set_new_handler(handler);
02028     
02029     return handler;
02030 }
02031 
02032 /*
02033  * operator new - Fortify's replacement new, 
02034  * without source-code information.
02035  */
02036 void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
02037 operator new(size_t size)
02038 {
02039     void *p;
02040     
02041     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_new,
02042                                 st_AllocatorName[Fortify_Allocator_new], 0)) == 0)
02043     {                            
02044         if (st_NewHandler())
02045             (*st_NewHandler())();
02046         else
02047             return 0;
02048     }
02049 
02050     return p;
02051 }
02052 
02053 /*
02054  * operator new - Fortify's replacement new,
02055  * with source-code information
02056  */
02057 void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
02058 operator new(size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
02059 {
02060     void *p;
02061 
02062     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_new, file, line)) == 0)
02063     {
02064         if (st_NewHandler())
02065             (*st_NewHandler())();
02066         else
02067             return 0;
02068     }
02069     
02070     return p;
02071 }
02072 
02073 #ifdef FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW
02074 
02075 /*
02076  * operator new[], without source-code info
02077  */
02078 void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
02079 operator new[](size_t size) 
02080 {
02081     void *p;
02082 
02083     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_array_new,
02084                                 st_AllocatorName[Fortify_Allocator_array_new], 0)) == 0)
02085     {                                
02086         if (st_NewHandler())
02087             (*st_NewHandler())();    
02088         else    
02089             return 0;
02090     }
02091     
02092     return p;
02093 }
02094 
02095 /*
02096  * operator new[], with source-code info
02097  */
02098 void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
02099 operator new[](size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
02100 {
02101     void *p;
02102 
02103     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_array_new, file, line)) == 0)
02104     {
02105         if (st_NewHandler())
02106             (*st_NewHandler())(); 
02107         else
02108             return 0;
02109     }
02110 
02111     return p;
02112 }

02114 #endif /* FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW */
02115 
02116 /*
02117  * Fortify_PreDelete - C++ does not allow overloading
02118  * of delete, so the delete macro calls Fortify_PreDelete
02119  * with the source-code info, and then calls delete.
02120  */
02121 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
02122 Fortify_PreDelete(const char *file, DWORD line)
02123 {
02124     FORTIFY_LOCK();
02125 
02126     /*
02127      * Push the source code info for the delete onto the delete stack
02128      * (if we have enough room, of course)
02129      */
02130     if (st_DeleteStackTop < FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE)
02131     {
02132         st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop] = file;
02133         st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop] = line;
02134     }
02135 
02136     st_DeleteStackTop++;
02137 }
02138 
02139 /*
02140  * Fortify_PostDelete() - Pop the delete source-code info
02141  * off the source stack.
02142  */
02143 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
02144 Fortify_PostDelete()
02145 {
02146     st_DeleteStackTop--;
02147 
02148     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
02149 }
02150 
02151 /*
02152  * operator delete - fortify's replacement delete
02153  */
02154 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
02155 operator delete(void *uptr)
02156 {
02157     const char *file;
02158     DWORD line;
02159 
02160      /*
02161       * It is defined to be harmless to delete 0
02162       */
02163     if (uptr == 0)
02164         return;
02165 
02166     /*
02167      * find the source-code info
02168      */
02169     if (st_DeleteStackTop)
02170     {
02171         if (st_DeleteStackTop < FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE)
02172         {
02173             file = st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
02174             line = st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
02175         }
02176         else
02177         {
02178             file = st_DeleteFile[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
02179             line = st_DeleteLine[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
02180         }
02181     }
02182     else
02183     {
02184         file = st_DeallocatorName[Fortify_Deallocator_delete];
02185         line = 0;
02186     }
02187 
02188     Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_delete, file, line);
02189 }
02190 
02191 #ifdef FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE
02192 
02193 /*
02194  * operator delete[] - fortify's replacement delete[]
02195  */
02196 void FORTIFY_STORAGE
02197 operator delete[](void *uptr)
02198 {
02199     const char *file;
02200     DWORD line;
02201 
02202      /*
02203       * It is defined to be harmless to delete 0
02204       */
02205     if (uptr == 0)
02206         return;
02207 
02208     /*
02209      * find the source-code info
02210      */
02211     if (st_DeleteStackTop)
02212     {
02213         if (st_DeleteStackTop < FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE)
02214         {
02215             file = st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
02216             line = st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
02217         }
02218         else
02219         {
02220             file = st_DeleteFile[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
02221             line = st_DeleteLine[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
02222         }
02223     }
02224     else
02225     {
02226         file = st_DeallocatorName[Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete];
02227         line = 0;
02228     }
02229 
02230     Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete, file, line);
02231 }
02232 
02233 #endif /* FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE */
02234 
02235 #ifdef FORTIFY_AUTOMATIC_LOG_FILE
02236 /* Automatic log file stuff!
02237  *
02238  * AutoLogFile class. There can only ever be ONE of these
02239  * instantiated! It is a static class, which means that
02240  * it's constructor will be called at program initialization,
02241  * and it's destructor will be called at program termination.
02242  * We don't know if the other static class objects have been
02243  * constructed/destructed yet, but this pretty much the best
02244  * we can do with standard C++ language features.
02245  */
02246 class Fortify_AutoLogFile
02247 {
02248     static FILE *fp;
02249     static int   written_something;
02250     static char *init_string, *term_string;
02251 
02252 public:
02253     Fortify_AutoLogFile()
02254     {
02255         written_something = 0;
02256         Fortify_SetOutputFunc(Fortify_AutoLogFile::Output);
02257         Fortify_EnterScope(init_string, 0);
02258     }
02259 
02260     static void Output(const char *s)
02261     {
02262         if (written_something == 0)
02263         {
02264             FORTIFY_FIRST_ERROR_FUNCTION;
02265             fp = fopen(FORTIFY_LOG_FILENAME, "w");
02266             if (fp)
02267             {
02268                 time_t t;
02269                 time(&t);
02270                 fprintf(fp, "Fortify log started at %s\n", ctime(&t));
02271                 written_something = 1;
02272             }    
02273         }
02274 
02275         if (fp)
02276         {
02277             fputs(s, fp);
02278             fflush(fp);
02279         }    
02280     }
02281     
02282     ~Fortify_AutoLogFile()
02283     {
02284         Fortify_LeaveScope(term_string, 0);
02285         Fortify_CheckAllMemory(term_string, 0);
02286         if (fp)
02287         {
02288             time_t t;
02289             time(&t);
02290             fprintf(fp, "\nFortify log closed at %s\n", ctime(&t));
02291             fclose(fp);
02292             fp = 0;
02293         }    
02294     }
02295 };
02296 
02297 FILE *Fortify_AutoLogFile::fp = 0;
02298 int   Fortify_AutoLogFile::written_something = 0;
02299 char *Fortify_AutoLogFile::init_string = "Program Initialization";
02300 char *Fortify_AutoLogFile::term_string = "Program Termination";
02301 
02302 static Fortify_AutoLogFile Abracadabra;
02303 
02304 #endif /* FORTIFY_AUTOMATIC_LOG_FILE */
02305 
02306 #endif /* __cplusplus */
02307 
02308 #endif /* USE_FORTIFY || USE_BSD_FORTIFY */
